entry.title: SAP for Energy & Utilities Conference ‚Äì Workshops Now Live
entry.content:
Dear Utilities Community,

The SAP for Energy and Utilities Conference, taking place April 21‚Äì23, 2026 in Toulouse, France ,  a city recently named #1 destination to visit in 2025 by Lonely Planet. Hosted at The MEETT, a state-of-the-art convention center, this event promises to be a transformative experience for professionals across the energy and utilities sector.

This year‚Äôs theme, ‚ÄúConnecting Minds. Powering the Future,‚Äù reflects the conference‚Äôs focus on innovation, AI, asset management, distributed energy resources, sustainability, and customer experience. Whether you're an SAP customer, prospect, partner, or industry leader, this is your opportunity to gain insights, share your story, and shape the future of energy.

Workshops Are Now Live!

The 2026 conference agenda is still evolving, but registration is already open, and workshop seats are limited! These interactive sessions offer a deep dive into the most critical challenges and key in the energy and utilities sector. Below are the confirmed workshops:

  • Utilities Focus ‚Äì Powering the Future: The Next Era of Utilities with SAP

  • Energising the Industry: SAP's Oil, Gas & Energy Solution Portfolio

Each workshop includes expert-led discussions, real-world case studies, and interactive Q&A sessions. You‚Äôll walk away with actionable insights and practical tools to drive transformation in your organisation, how to apply AI and BDC effectively, while strengthening your understanding of SAP‚Äôs service portfolio, fully equipped to turn knowledge into measurable results.

Why Attend?

entry.title: Self Refining Prompts for a better Customer Experience
entry.content:
Teaching AI applications to Self-Critique

My Experiments with Self-Refining prompts

Most of us treat a prompt like a one-shot instruction. You ask, the model answers, and‚Ä¶ that‚Äôs it. But in practice, good work is iterative: we write a draft, critique it, and then refine. Self-Refine applies that same loop to AI ‚Äî the model acts as writer, critic, and editor in quick succession until the result feels right.

In this post, I‚Äôll share what clicked for me, a simple three-step pattern, and a few mini-experiments you can try (and screenshot) to see the lift for yourself.

The 3-Step Loop (that changed how I prompt)

1) Generate ‚Äì Ask for the initial output.
2) Feedback ‚Äì Ask the model to critique its own output with specific, actionable notes.
3) Refine ‚Äì Tell it to rewrite using only that feedback.
Repeat until it says, ‚Äúno further refinement.‚Äù

This is simple. The magic is in good feedback prompts (‚Äúpoint out tone, missing details, structure‚Äù vs. vague ‚Äúimprove it‚Äù).

How it works (in 10 seconds)

  • Generate: Draft the answer
  • Critique: The model reviews itself (JSON feedback + score)
  • Refine: It rewrites using that feedback
  • Stop: when the score plateaus or hits your bar

Task-specific effectiveness: Self-refinement works better for some task types (code generation, technical documentation) than others (creative writing). Measures vary for each task category.‚Äã

Mini-Experiments

Building a self-improving web search Agent 

Building a Web Search Agent with Self-Improving Prompts
The foundation combines SAP AI Core's Generative AI Hub with LangChain's Google Search wrapper:
```python
# SAP AI Core client setup
ai_core_client = AICoreV2Client(
    base_url=BASE_URL, auth_url=AUTH_URL,
    client_id=CLIENT_ID, client_secret=CLIENT_SECRET,
)
llm = init_llm(MODEL_NAME, temperature=0.0, max_tokens=512)

# Google Search integration
search = GoogleSearchAPIWrapper(k=5)
google_tool = Tool.from_function(
    name="google_search",
    description="Search Google and return the first results",
    func=search.run
)
agent = initialize_agent(tools=[google_tool], llm=llm, agent=AgentType.OPENAI_FUNCTIONS)

#This gives us both a base LLM and an agent that can search the web when needed.
The Three-Prompt Pattern
The self-refinement uses three distinct prompts with clear roles:
Generator Prompt: Creates initial draft without second-guessing
GEN_PROMPT = """You are a careful, precise assistant.
TASK: {task}
Produce the best possible answer. Do not include any self-critique here."""
```
Critic Prompt: Evaluates with structured feedback
CRITIC_PROMPT = """You are a meticulous reviewer. Given the TASK and the DRAFT answer,
1) list EXACTLY 3 concrete issues or improvement opportunities,
2) give a numbered improvement plan,
3) rate current quality from 0‚Äì100,
4) decide if refinement is still needed.

Respond with a SINGLE JSON object and NOTHING ELSE:
{{"issues": ["...", "...", "..."], "plan": ["step 1", "step 2", "step 3"], "score": 0, "stop": false}}"""
```
Refiner Prompt: Applies improvements systematically
REFINE_PROMPT = """You are a senior editor. Apply the plan below to improve the DRAFT.
Keep all correct content; fix issues; increase clarity, correctness, and usefulness.
Return ONLY the improved answer (no commentary)."""```
The key is separating generation from critique to avoid the model sabotaging its own initial work.
The Self-Refine Loop
def self_refine(
    task: str,
    max_iters: int = 3,
    min_delta: int = 2,
    use_agent_for_initial: bool = False
) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    """
    Self-refine loop: GENERATE -> CRITIQUE -> REFINE until stop or plateau.
    Returns final answer and iteration history.
    """
    history: List[Dict[str, Any]] = []

    # 1) Initial draft
    draft = call_llm_text(GEN_PROMPT.format(task=task), use_agent=use_agent_for_initial)
    history.append({"iteration": 0, "draft": draft, "score": None, "feedback": None})

    best = draft
    best_score = -math.inf

    for i in range(1, max_iters + 1):
        # 2) Critique
        critic_raw = call_llm_text(CRITIC_PROMPT.format(task=task, draft=draft))
        critic = extract_json_block(critic_raw)

        # Safety coerce
        issues = critic.get("issues", [])[:3]
        plan = critic.get("plan", [])
        score = int(critic.get("score", 50))
        stop_flag = bool(critic.get("stop", False))

        history.append({
            "iteration": i,
            "draft": draft,
            "score": score,
            "feedback": {"issues": issues, "plan": plan, "raw": critic_raw}
        })

        # Plateau / stop condition
        if stop_flag and i > 1:
            break
        if best_score != -math.inf and (score - best_score) < min_delta and i > 1:
            # No meaningful improvement
            break

        # Track best
        if score > best_score:
            best = draft
            best_score = score

        # 3) Refine
        plan_str = "\n".join(f"- {p}" for p in plan) if plan else "- Improve clarity and correctness."
        refined = call_llm_text(REFINE_PROMPT.format(task=task, draft=draft, plan=plan_str))
        draft = refined

    # Final scoring pass to attach a last score
    final_critic_raw = call_llm_text(CRITIC_PROMPT.format(task=task, draft=draft))
    final_critic = extract_json_block(final_critic_raw) or {"score": best_score if best_score != -math.inf else None}
    final_score = int(final_critic.get("score", best_score if best_score != -math.inf else 0))

    return {
        "task": task,
        "final": draft,
        "final_score": final_score,
        "history": history,
        "final_critic_raw": final_critic_raw
    }
Usage Example
# runner + example usage
def run_task_self_refine(
    task: str,
    max_iters: int = 3,
    min_delta: int = 2,
    use_agent_for_initial: bool = False,
    verbose: bool = True
) -> Dict[str, Any]:
    result = self_refine(
        task=task,
        max_iters=max_iters,
        min_delta=min_delta,
        use_agent_for_initial=use_agent_for_initial
    )
    if verbose:
        for rec in result["history"]:
            it = rec["iteration"]
            pretty_print_blocks(f"Iteration {it} ‚Äî Draft", rec["draft"])
            if rec["feedback"]:
                fb = rec["feedback"]
                pretty_print_blocks(f"Iteration {it} ‚Äî Feedback (score={rec['score']})", json.dumps({
                    "issues": fb["issues"],
                    "plan": fb["plan"]
                }, indent=2))
        pretty_print_blocks(f"FINAL (score={result['final_score']})", result["final"])
    return result

# Example task (swap in anything you like)
Search_Query = "How to integrate SAP Shopping Assistant with SAP Commerce Cloud?"

result = run_task_self_refine(
    Search_Query, 
    max_iters=3, 
    min_delta=2, 
    use_agent_for_initial=True  # Use web search for initial draft
)
Setting `use_agent_for_initial=True` leverages the Google Search agent for the first draft when current information might be needed.
Using LLM, I compared all three outputs I got. Here is the result
ItemIteration 0Iteration 1 (Feedback)Iteration 2Iteration 2 (Feedback)FINAL
UI NavigationGenericAsk for detailed pathsAdds named tabs/panelsRequest more explicit stepsClear, step-by-step paths
PerformanceSeparate checklistAsk to integrate in stepsStill separateAsk for actionable guidanceEmbedded, actionable tips
ValidationBrief & vagueAsk to expand per componentIncompleteAsk for full, concrete checks10 concrete, testable checks
PitfallsShort list‚ÄîSameAsk for fixesPitfalls paired with fixes
CompletenessOK‚ÄîCuts offAsk to finishComplete & ready to run
Key Benefits
-Quality Improvement: Typical 15-25 point score increases over 2-3 iterations
-Cost Control: Plateau detection prevents wasteful refinement cycles
-Flexibility: Can use plain LLM or web-search agent based on task needs
-Transparency: Full iteration history shows the improvement process
Quality Improvement Analysis ( So far, the best score that I achieved)
Score Progress  
Iteration 0:45/100Basic initial draft
Iteration 1:68/100+23 Points improvement
Iteration 2:87/100+19 Points improvement
 
Total Improvement: +42 points (93.3% increase)
 The Answers transformed from vague steps to specific, executable instructions

The simulation shows the typical self-refinement pattern where the biggest jump occurs in iteration 1 (+23 points), with diminishing but still valuable returns in iteration 2 (+19 points).

But here's the reality check: This represents a best-case scenario. During my experiments, I also encountered:

Complete refinement failures where systems produced identical content across iterations despite clear feedback, Content truncation issues where later iterations became incomplete, cutting off mid-sentence, Score plateaus where quality metrics stayed flat (75/100) even after visible improvements


The approach works especially well for tasks requiring accuracy and completeness, like coding, technical procedures, troubleshooting guides, and detailed explanations, where initial drafts often miss important details.
 
Self Improving Prompts - Example  -- This was the most common behavior 

What surprised me

  • The biggest gains come in the first 1‚Äì2 rounds. After that, returns fade.
  • Weak models can struggle to give good feedback. Strong instruction-following models do best. [ I call them the most obedient models:-)]
  • If feedback is vague, the rewrite is useless. If feedback is dimensioned and specific, the quality of the output excels.

How to use Self-Refine in a Customer Support Chatbot

Self-Refine is perfect for support bots because real customers are often vague (‚Äúmy order didn‚Äôt arrive,‚Äù ‚Äúcan‚Äôt login‚Äù).

Goals

  • Clarify fast when the query is vague and has very less details.
  • Ground answers in your KB/CRM (no hallucinations).
  • Converge in 1‚Äì2 refinement rounds to keep latency low.
  • Escalate cleanly when confidence stays low.

 How can we model this?

TLDR for practitioners

Treat prompts like drafts. Ask the model to critique with structure, then refine under constraints. Screenshot the three steps (Generate ‚Üí Feedback ‚Üí Refine) to make the improvement visible. Once you see it, it‚Äôs hard to go back to one-shot prompting.

Self-refinement works better for some task types (code generation, technical documentation) than others (creative writing). 

Cost vs. quality tradeoff: Calculate the token cost per quality point gained. For some applications, a single well-crafted prompt may be more cost-effective than multiple iteration refinements.
Bottom line: self-refining prompts make your bot think twice‚Äîso customers don‚Äôt have to ask twice.

entry.title: Brazil as One of the Leading Hubs for Artificial Intelligence (2024‚Äì2025)
entry.content:
Over the past two years, Brazil has established itself as one of the main Artificial Intelligence (AI) hubs globally, standing out for its combination of public investments, expanding business ecosystem, and regulatory progress. Traditionally a leader in innovation and technology in Latin America, Brazil is now attracting international attention by accelerating the adoption of AI across strategic sectors such as finance, energy, agribusiness, and public services.

In 2024, the Brazilian government launched the Brazilian Artificial Intelligence Plan (PBIA) 2024‚Äì2028, a program with an estimated investment of R$ 23 billion dedicated to AI research, development, and infrastructure. The plan aims to strengthen technological sovereignty, foster innovation through universities, and support companies in applying AI to practical use cases, particularly in areas of public interest.

The Main pillars of the PBIA 2024‚Äì2028 are:

  • Expansion of AI research and innovation centers;
  • Tax incentives for startups and public‚Äìprivate partnerships;
  • Training and qualification of AI professionals;
  • Implementation of AI in public services (health, security, education).

This initiative positions Brazil as a regional leader in AI policy, ahead of countries like Mexico, Chile, and Argentina.

Brazil‚Äôs private sector is undergoing a phase of rapid AI adoption. By 2025, a national survey identified 396 Brazilian AI companies focused on marketing applications, reflecting diversification across generative AI, automation, analytics, and digital services.

According to a Bain & Company (2025) study, 67% of Brazilian companies now consider AI a strategic priority, a major leap from 2024, when only about 12% had active projects. This demonstrates the transition from experimental use to mature, production-level adoption.

Brazil received international investments and technological infrastructure. That's why Brazil‚Äôs consolidation as an AI hub also stems from the confidence of major global players. In September 2024, Microsoft announced a US$ 2.7 billion investment in cloud and AI infrastructure in Brazil, one of the largest technology investments in Latin American history. In 2025, Eletrobras partnered with C3 AI to modernize Brazil‚Äôs power grid using AI and machine learning, highlighting the industrial applications of advanced technologies.

These moves strengthen Brazil‚Äôs position as a regional hub for data and high-performance computing, essential for scaling generative AI and automation initiatives.

Despite major progress, Brazil still faces structural challenges. A SAP Brazil (March 2025) survey revealed that:

  • 29% of companies lack clarity on how to integrate AI into their business systems;
  • 28% cite a shortage of skilled professionals as the main obstacle.

On the regulatory front, Brazil has emerged as a key player. In 2024, the National Data Protection Authority (ANPD) suspended Meta Platforms‚Äô privacy policy, which used Brazilians‚Äô personal data to train generative AI models. This decision marked an important milestone in ethical governance and digital sovereignty, aligning Brazil with European-style data protection principles.

The main sectors driving AI growth in Brazil include:

  • Finance and digital payments: automation and predictive analytics;
  • Energy: smart grids and real-time system optimization;
  • Agribusiness: crop forecasting and climate analytics;
  • Healthcare: assisted diagnostics and telemedicine;
  • Public administration: chatbots and natural language processing for citizen services.

These industries attract investments from both large corporations and local startups, making Brazil a fertile ground for experimentation and innovation.

About the Outlook for 2025 and Beyond the trends indicate continued expansion of generative AI and process automation in Brazilian companies. By the end of 2025, it is expected that:

  • Over 60% of corporate AI solutions in Brazil will involve generative models;
  • The country will consolidate international research and training partnerships;
  • The General Artificial Intelligence Law (under discussion in Congress) will advance the national governance framework.

With growing public and private investments, Brazil is on track to become a Latin American reference in AI innovation and ethics, combining economic growth with responsible technological governance.

The 2024‚Äì2025 period marks a strategic turning point for AI in Brazil, shifting from an emerging topic to a core pillar of industrial and business competitiveness. The alignment between government vision, international investments, and technological maturity positions Brazil as one of the leading AI hubs in the Southern Hemisphere, with the potential to export technology, talent, and regulatory best practices.

At MakeValue, we develop AI-powered applications for SAP Finance, focused on enhancing financial visibility and decision-making. Our Cash Flow Intelligence App leverages data from Supply Chain, Sales, Treasury, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, and real-time Bank Balances to deliver accurate forecasting and scenario simulation, ensuring that financial teams have a clear, data-driven view of their company‚Äôs liquidity at any time.

Is your company already exploring AI implementation projects? In which sectors or business processes are you seeing the greatest potential for transformation?

References

  • Reuters: Microsoft to invest $2.7 billion in Brazil
  • Reuters: Brazil proposes $4 billion AI investment plan
  • SAP News Brazil (2025): Brazil leads in AI adoption among enterprises
  • Bain & Company (2025): Artificial Intelligence Adoption Survey
  • Instituto IA ‚Äì LNCC (2024‚Äì2025): Mapping of AI Research Groups in Brazil
  • Poder360 (2024): Brazil to become Latin America‚Äôs AI hub with R$ 22 billion by 2028

entry.title: SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Dallas focused on the intersection of AI and UX
entry.content:
Thanks to the ASUG Dallas chapter for helping us reach new audiences with SAP Fiori Innovation Day Dallas. We had a dedicated track within the larger ASUG event in which participants could learn about the latest user experience innovations, build an SAP Fiori elements app in less than 90 minutes, and see some sneak previews of AI-powered functionality that we‚Äôre working on. They also asked our sponsors questions during a panel discussion and found many useful tips they could use back in the office.

In the keynote, ASUG CEO, Geoff Scott, made a compelling case that moving to the cloud is a prerequisite for innovation at speed. In his interactive session, he polled the audience to give people a sense of how they compare to their peers in terms of innovation and adoption of various technologies. Many companies were using AI in some capacity, and some rely on multiple AI tools.  It was interesting to see what use cases the attendees find most relevant.

ASUG found that automation and analytics are the top AI use cases.

In the UX Strategy and What‚Äôs New section, Ioannis and Ute talked about the continuing evolution of SAP Fiori, how SAP Fiori elements brings the Fiori design system to apps in SAP S/4HANA, and demoed the Fiori experience in SAP Cloud ERP. They showed new AI-powered capabilities in My Home, such as Recap and recommendations, and explained how AI built into the SAP Fiori elements framework powers easy filter, smart summarization, and error explanation. All of this functionality combines to make business users more productive by making it faster and easier to find the apps and data they need in their S/4HANA system.

We had a day full of learning and fun.

In the partner panel, experts from Mygo Consulting, Qubittron, Mindset Consulting, and cbs Corporate Business Solutions shared their expertise on:

  • How organizations measure the return on investment for UX and AI projects.
  • Where AI playing a role in UX and how agents fit into the picture.
  • The relative value of AI for business users and developers.
  • The top AI use cases that make sense for companies
  • Where to focus your efforts in the near term to gain benefits from AI

Thanks to Sujeeth, Sidhartha, Andy, and Bastian for your unique insights and actionable advice. I found it interesting that many of the topics that people mentioned would be useful in the future were already part of our ‚Äúone more thing‚Äù session at the end of the day.

The hands-on workshop focused on using AI to accelerate the process of building SAP Fiori apps. Participants used AI in three main ways:

  1. Gathering user requirements in a business requirement documents or via sketching
  2. Uploading the resulting document into SAP Fiori tools AI to generate an SAP Fiori elements app
  3. Making further updates and refinements to the application

We used SAP Fiori tools extensively. This is a logical choice since they are built into SAP Business Application Studio.

The final session of the day (and highest rated) was our lab preview / sneak peak at a few projects are currently in development. As with any discussion of future functionality, we made it clear that these demos might or might not turn into actual products. With this in mind, Sebastian and Katja showed:

  • Vibe coding using MCP servers. (Vibe coding was also part of the ASUG keynote, so this is clearly becoming a mainstream topic, at least among software developers.)
  • App Finder to make it easier to find information in your S/4HANA system.
  • Easy Fill, which speeds up data entry by extracting content from an email or other text and using it to update the relevant fields in an app built using an SAP Fiori elements object page.
  • Smart Helpers to make it easier to get your work done in SAP. I‚Äôm being deliberately vague here as we‚Äôll share more at SAP TechEd and its companion roadshows in early November 2025.

Thanks to everyone who made SAP Fiori Innovation Day a success

SAP Presenters (in order of appearance): Ioannis Grammatikakis, Ute Oemler, Sebastian Steinhauer, Katja Zoch

SAP Fiori Innovation Day sponsors: cbs Corporate Business Solutions, Mindset Consulting, Qubittron, and Mygo Consulting

ASUG events team: Nicole Kern, Kara Hughes

ASUG volunteers: Heather Davis, Simon To

Behind the scenes team: all the developers, architects, product managers and other colleagues who built the functionality and set up the demos and hands-on systems.

All the customers: we appreciate your questions, which help us understand your priorities and focus our development resources.

Next steps

  • Register for the monthly SAP Fiori development roundtable call to meet other developers and architects who build SAP Fiori apps.
  • Subscribe to the SAP Fiori development newsletter, in which we share updates on SAP Fiori elements, SAP Fiori tools, SAPUI5, and SAP Build Code every other month.
  • Explore the SAP Fiori Development Portal to see how SAP Fiori elements can boost developer productivity, drive UX consistency, and ensure your apps have the enterprise readiness features your users expect.
  • Join us at TechEd Berlin or virtual or at the next SAP Fiori Innovation Day in Walldorf

entry.title: Do you know how to solve business problems using SAP's Generative AI Hub?
entry.content:
I recommend to look at our latest Solving Business Problems using SAP's Generative AI Hub Learning Journey.

Learning outcome

After completing this learning journey,

  • You will discover how SAP Business AI streamlines processes, improves decisions, and drives scalable innovation.
  • After this, you will gain a strong grasp of Large Language Models and their application within SAP, including their strengths, limitations, and integration through SAP‚Äôs generative AI hub.
  • You will explore the capabilities of SAP‚Äôs generative AI hub, learning to navigate its interfaces, manage models, and orchestrate AI workflows for enterprise use.
  • You will develop hands-on skills in designing, refining, and managing prompts, using prompt templates and the Prompt Registry to ensure consistency and scalability across business applications.
  • Finally, you will master grounding techniques to connect AI outputs with trusted enterprise data, enabling context-aware and reliable solutions.
  • By the end, you will be equipped to design, implement, and optimize robust AI solutions that drive measurable value and innovation for your organization.

Goals

  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics 
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning
Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards, Katrin

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approaching‚Äîthe premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

üîóExplore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Center‚Äôs AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

üîóCalculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

entry.title: Generative AI, MCP and SAP; What are these and how to make the most of it?
entry.content:
Hi All,

Generative AI is the current buzzword in the market. Potentially, every clients, companies and adapting to it on fast pace. Recently SAP had introduced support for Model Context Protocol. With this particular blog, I'll be trying to make you all understand what MCP is, how we can make the best use of it for your SAP systems.

What is Model context protocol? (MCP)?
 It is basically an open, standardized approach that enables Large Language Models (LLMs) and AI agents to access up to date,  enterprise data - In our case, across SAP and other business systems on demand.

As Large Language Models (LLMs) like ChatGPT-4, Claude, Gemini, Llama3 etc evolve, we need standardized ways to connect them to tools, APIs, and systems. Imagine trying to follow different connectors/API for each LLM!
However, these models operate in isolation based on pre-trained data and don‚Äôt have built-in access to real-time data, databases , external APIs, or local files. Which is where MCP kicks in.

Below figure shows how MCP Client( Potentially LLMs or AI Agents) could connect to SAP systems.

MCP follows a client-server architecture, where:

  • Clients (like AI applications or LLMs) connect to
  • Servers (MCP tool providers) expose tools, APIs, or data sources to clients.

In our case, As an example- We can connect any AI agent to automate the workflows, or any AI models, using MCP to SAP systems, which would have access to the system and train from enterprise data.

Potential Use-cases:

  1. SAP GUI automation- Autonomous GUI Agent:

    Agent to automate interactions with SAP GUI, enabling programmatic control of SAP transactions. This can automate manual processes, activities which users perform on day to day basis.

    Automation scope:

    • Automation and workflows
    • Automating repetitive SAP business processes and transactions
    • Extracting specific data from SAP screens and tables for reporting or analysis
    • Integrating SAP GUI automation into AI-powered desktop assistants or custom applications

    How does it work?

    AI Agent can be fed with recorded steps, It can read and understand the fields, adapt with time; Unlike using RPA which is trained to exactly copy and execute the system actions.


    Advantage:
    Automate repetitive, heinous tasks.

  2. Enhanced Analytics and Reporting- Create dashboard and statistics.
    Scope:
    System reads, understands data and patterns and potentially (examples) answer below queries:

    ‚ÄúWhats the usage of product XXX?‚Äù
    ‚ÄúTell me the product which is most used during XXX months/quarter?‚Äù

    Advantage:
    Build dashboards, reports instantly based on the data required

  3. Understand what custom functionality does, AI can read the code, Create of functional, technical documentations:

    Let‚Äôs consider a case where a vendor has done custom development and It is a blackbox to us, AI helps us to read, analyze and provide a basic understanding of the custom enhancement, saving time and efforts. The same can be extracted as documentation for future references.

    Examples:
    ‚ÄúExplain this legacy ABAP report in plain english and add detailed in-line comments‚Äù

    Result- Understand complex, undocumented Z-programs, making analysis and decisions faster.

  4.  Fiori MCP Server/Write UI5 code using agents:

    -Developers can build apps faster using MCP servers.
    -Write UI5 code using agents.

    Examples:
    ‚ÄúAdd flexible row layout for the app‚Äù
    ‚ÄúGenerate a new project and SAP Fiori app based on ‚Äúmy sketch.jpg‚Äù

    ‚ÄúHow can I style an sap.m.Button to appear as a "reject" action?"
    "Help me migrate any deprecated UI5 API usage in this UI5 controller"

     

     

  5.  AI Assisted coding:

    MCP Clients to assist Consultants with coding, code reviews etc

  6. Smart IoT, Yard integrations, Smart Dock scheduling, Automated calls etc

    -Attain End to End track and trace information for Boxes with prompting

    -Dock Appointment scheduling using phone calls with AI voice assistant.

     

  7. Custom Chatbot- Only integrated for client data:

    End users can enquire, ask things to the chatbox which is integrated with SAP. (Can be Enabled for consultants as well).

    • Gain Information on business processes; In most organizations, Information relevant to any business process is often scattered across multiple business applications, databases, cloud systems, and files, both inside and outside of SAP. 
    • For AI agents to deliver meaningful answers and actions, they need access to all relevant data, not just data isolated SAP tables. 
    • With MCP, the connection between entire enterprise system and AI agents can be built easily.

     

  8.  How could this fit in EWM?

    Since I come from EWM (Extended Warehouse Management) background, These are few use-cases which I had in mind:
    • Custom Chatbot- only integrated for client data
    • Demand Forecasting- Enable models to predict future demand of products
    • Slotting & rearrangement- Suggest optimal bin placement for products- Helping drastically in production, Kanban processes, Urgent flows etc
    • Labour Management-Estimate, optimize workforce allocation.
    • Picking optimization- Learn, optimize picking routes for different processes on floor.
    • Learn queue, issues, patterns and take corrective/follow on actions.

     

    Please do share your feedback, ideas pertaining to your modules and your thoughts. Thanks for your time!

    Aman Orchard

entry.title: [Session Reply & Slides Available] Hot Topic: Joule Activation for SAP Cloud ERP (Public Edition)
entry.content:
SAP S/4HANA Cloud Expertise Service Team and SAP AI RIG team recently co-present a deep-dive session focused on enabling ‚ÄåJoule‚Äå - SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot - for SAP Cloud ERP.

The agenda covered as below and feel free to access [Slides] [Recording]. 

  • Business AI capabilities and use cases
  • Joule‚Äôs technical architecture on SAP Business Technology Platform (BTP)
  • Step-by-step activation process for S/4HANA Public Cloud
  • Q&A and live troubleshooting

1. Key Objectives‚Äå

  • Demonstrate Joule‚Äôs value in streamlining business processes (e.g., sales order management, issue resolution in status check).
  • Guide participants through end-to-end setup using BTP booster, destinations, and identity management.
  • Equip partners to deploy Joule for customers with minimal friction.

2. Business AI & Joule Introduction‚Äå

Joule Definition‚Äå
  • SAP‚Äôs generative AI copilot embedded in cloud solutions to automate tasks, provide contextual insights, and reduce manual effort.
Primary Use Case‚Äå:
  • Navigational support (e.g., finding apps without memorizing transaction codes)
  • Transactional support (e.g., creating insights cards, resolving incomplete sales orders)
  • Informational support (e.g., find SAP Help document for relevant business process)
Demo Highlight
  • Create Insights Cards with Joule
  • Check Sales Order Status with Joule‚Äå:Joule identifies incomplete orders, highlights missing fields (e.g., payment terms), and guides users to resolve issues

3. Technical Architecture & Activation Flow‚Äå

3.1 Core Components‚Äå:

  • Joule Web Client‚Äå is embedded across SAP cloud solutions (e.g., SuccessFactors, S/4HANA)
  • BTP Subaccount‚Äå
    • Hosts Joule instance
    • SAP Build Work Zone
    • connectivity services
  • Cloud Identity Services‚Äå
    • Manages authentication (IAS)
    • Identity / role synchronization (IPS)
  • S/4HANA Cloud APIs‚Äå: Data source for Joule‚Äôs responses.

3.2 Activation Steps‚Äå:

Prerequisites‚Äå:
  • BTP global account with Joule entitlements
  • S/4HANA system registered to BTP
BTP Subaccount Setup‚Äå:
  • Create subaccount in preferred region/hyperscaler
  • Assign entitlements:
    • SAP Build Work Zone (foundation or standard edition)
    • Joule service
  • Establish trust to Cloud Identity Services tenant
  • Add S/4HANA domain to trusted destinations
Joule Booster Execution‚Äå:
  • Guided setup for BTP formations.
  • Integrate S/4HANA, Build Work Zone, and Cloud Identity Services
Post-Booster Configurations‚Äå:
  • Verify communication arrangements in S/4HANA (e.g., Digital Assistant Service - 0882).
  • Verify BTP Destinations
  • Verify SAP Build Work Zone Content for S/4HANA
  • Configure Identity Provisioning (IPS) to sync users/roles from S/4HANA to Build Work Zone
Validation‚Äå:
  • Ensure Joule icon appears in S/4HANA Launchpad.
  • Test capabilities (e.g., querying open sales orders).

4. Critical Notes & Pitfalls‚Äå

  • Trust Configuration‚Äå: Ensure all solutions in a Joule formation use the ‚Äåsame Cloud Identity Services tenant‚Äå.
  • Destination Errors‚Äå: Verify hostnames, client IDs, and secrets in navigation service manually if not auto-generated.
  • Identity Provisioning‚Äå: Ensure IPS jobs run successfully to propagate roles to SAP Build Work Zone.

5. Next Steps & Resources‚Äå

Discovery Center Missions:
  1. https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missiondetail/4538/4826/
  2. https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missiondetail/4452/4738/
Support Channels‚Äå:
  • SAP Community - Business AI 
  • SAP Support for technical errors.
Upcoming Sessions‚Äå:
  • Implement SAP Business AI for SAP Cloud ERP (Oct 27th)
  • Vietnam localization for implementation (Oct 28th)

entry.title: AI-innovations in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025
entry.content:
The release of SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 marks a significant leap forward in enterprise automation and intelligence, as presented in this product blog by @BeSchulze. This release, the result of two years of focused development, places artificial intelligence at the core ‚Äì seamlessly integrated across business areas to redefine how work gets done.

Central to this update is the new agentic AI framework, where task-specific agents work together under the orchestration of our copilot Joule. More than just assistance, SAP‚Äôs persona-based AI acts as the new interface ‚Äì guiding users through processes, answering questions, and delivering relevant insights within the tools they use every day. Customers can now experience improved transparency, faster decision-making, and simplified operations, with intelligent capabilities integrated directly into their business flow.

Dive into the accompanying video for a glimpse of how these AI-driven capabilities are transforming daily work and setting a new benchmark for enterprise management.

 

 

Agentic Use cases

Asset Management: Maintenance Planner

In the area of Asset Management, planning maintenance activities often requires seamless access to the right tools at the right time. The Maintenance Planner feature, newly integrated with Joule, enhances this process by providing direct navigation to scheduling applications within SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. This innovation means that maintenance planners no longer need to sift through catalogs, as they can intuitively access relevant apps directly from their conversations, such as asking, "How to visualize maintenance work?" and receiving immediate links to resource scheduling applications. By embedding SAP Help documentation into Joule‚Äôs conversational responses, planners gain quick insights and can focus more on optimally scheduling maintenance tasks, thus ensuring that assets are well-managed without the hassle of navigation detours.

Eager to learn more? Check out our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Finance: Simpliyfying invoice dispute with the dispute manager

Untangling an incorrect invoice can feel like detective work, searching for clues across different systems. Now, with the Dispute Manager agent in SAP Cloud ERP Private your finance team has a new partner. A finance expert can simply ask Joule to pull up a dispute case by its number or show recent invoices for a customer. From that single conversation, they can review the details and then instruct Joule to either reject the dispute or navigate them directly to the app to create a credit note. This conversational approach turns a complex, multi-step investigation into a streamlined and guided dialogue. It not only saves valuable time for your team but also leads to quicker resolutions, helping maintain positive customer relationships.

For more information, please refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance: Empowering Trade Classification with an AI Agent  

Imagine trying to import a new fitness tracker and facing a complex web of customs classifications, where one wrong choice could mean costly delays. The Joule Agent for Trade Classification in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 makes this task straightforward by analyzing your product's data against global customs rules. For example, it might conclude a fitness tracker falls under the wristwatches category and provide legal notes to back this decision, keeping your team informed and in control. By transforming the complex classification process into a guided interaction, your trade professionals have more time to focus on strategy rather than paperwork. This not only enhances the speed and accuracy of your compliance processes but also strengthens your ability to meet market demands swiftly. With this AI innovation, your business can confidently and efficiently pursue global growth, minimizing delays and maximizing opportunities.

To learn more, consult our SAP Help Portal and watch the demo video below.

 

 

Sales LoB

Elevating sales efficiency with AI-driven solution quotation management

Speaking of the Sales line of business, where time is of the essence, managing solution quotations can be a complex task. The introduction of Joule as a digital assistant in SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 simplifies this process by allowing sales reps to execute tasks like creation, updating, and searching of solution quotations with conversational, natural language commands. This empowers sales teams to focus on high-value opportunities, such as quotations about to expire or those with significant client interest, and make well-informed decisions with clarity and speed. By streamlining the access to critical information, Joule helps reduce operational time and enhances the agility of sales professionals, allowing them to concentrate on building stronger customer relationships and fulfilling sales targets.

 

 

For more information read our dedicated pages on performing release and acceptance of solution quotations and fetching solution quotation information.

 

Seamlessly creating billing documents with AI

Imagine transforming the intricate process of billing document creation into an efficient, effortless operation‚Äîthis is where Joule steps in. The AI-powered capabilities of Joule allow users to effortlessly generate billing documents, whether they stem from a single reference or a collection of sales and delivery documents. This intuitive system supports the creation of both individual and collective billing documents, tailored to meet diverse business needs with pinpoint accuracy. For R&D departments, this means a streamlined workflow where administrative overhead is minimized, allowing more focus on innovation and product development. By simplifying navigation and enabling quick access to essential apps like Display Billing Documents, Joule enhances the accuracy and efficiency of billing processes, paving the way for more strategic decision-making. With this kind of intelligent assistance, your team spends less time on the nitty-gritty and more time driving the business forward.

 For more details, consult the SAP Help Portal.

 

Sourcing & Procurement LoB

AI-assisted creation of purchase requisitions 

Let‚Äôs take a look at the Sourcing & Procurement Line of Business. In this area creating purchase requisitions is a task that demands accuracy and efficiency. With the AI-assisted capabilities of Joule, the process becomes intuitive, allowing users, particularly casual ones, to navigate and complete requisitions merely through conversational prompts. This smart assistance helps in understanding various languages, correcting misspelled data, and even suggesting sources of supply promptly, thereby minimizing manual overhead and enhancing speed in decision-making. By embracing the future potential of speech recognition, Joule promises to make procurement tasks even more seamless, supporting operational purchasers in reducing free text entries and ensuring order clarity.

 For more details, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Finance LoB

Simplified subscription order management*

In Finance, is often fragmented and error-prone. Teams spend valuable time reconciling contracts, processing changes, and ensuring compliance - effort that slows down financial operations and puts transparency at risk.

Joule tackles this challenge by simplifying subscription management end to end. It guides users through creating orders, automatically filling key fields once core details are entered. Contract information is easy to access and aligned with attributes like customer or product ID, while intuitive summaries provide quick snapshots of activation status. By streamlining these steps, Joule boosts efficiency, improves transparency, and allows businesses to focus on growth rather than administrative tasks.

 

For more information, consult the SAP Help Portal.  

 

Joule for cash management assistant*

Picture your finance team, once bogged down in manual cash flow tracking, now effortlessly navigating a sea of numbers with ease. With Joule, you can quickly verify if due bank statements are received, fetch opening balances, and factor in expected cash flows, all in one seamless process. By providing accurate calculations of expected closing balances, Joule proactively alerts you to potential cash shortages or surpluses. This efficiency not only saves substantial time but also empowers you to optimize cash usage strategically. In a world where timing is everything, having this level of clarity allows your business to maintain a robust financial footing and seize opportunities as they arise. 

 

 

For more details, refer to the SAP Help Portal. 

*planned availability in November 2025  with the  update of Joule framework

Supply Chain LoB

Joule navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management

In managing warehouse operations, finding the right tools quickly can make all the difference between seamless or sluggish performance. With the introduction of Joule copilot navigation in SAP Fiori apps for extended warehouse management, SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 enhances user experience by guiding employees effortlessly to the most suitable applications for their tasks. This AI-driven assistance not only accelerates warehouse processes but also minimizes the need for extensive user training, ensuring employees can focus on their core responsibilities rather than app navigation. The real value lies in the comprehensive insights this innovation provides, empowering users to make informed decisions that enhance efficiency across operations.

 Eager to learn more? Consult our SAP Help Portal.

 

Service Management LoB

Creating follow-ups for in-house service objects with Joule

Now let‚Äôs have a look at the Service Management LoB. Here, Joule's AI-driven capabilities enable service managers to easily search, display, and create follow-ups for in-house service objects using conversational interactions. This human-centric approach optimizes daily tasks by allowing managers to seamlessly access critical information and act upon it without the need for complex navigation. By streamlining these processes, service management teams can focus on what truly matters‚Äîdelivering quality service to their customers. Such enhancements in task efficiency lead to more responsive service operations, ensuring a proactive approach toward managing service demands.

 

 

For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal.

 

Research and Development LoB

Intelligent project assistant capabilities with Joule

Navigating through a sea of data is commonplace in Research and Development (R&D) area, yet it doesn't have to be a drain on your team's creativity and productivity. The intelligent project assistant capabilities powered by Joule allow users to derive project data through natural language inquiries without the hassle of navigating multiple applications. This ease of access aids in quickly retrieving updates on project changes, identifying missing parts, and tracking due activities, all through Joule‚Äôs conversational interface. By supporting informational, navigational, and transactional capabilities, Joule transforms project management into a streamlined process, helping teams stay focused on innovation rather than administrative tasks. Moreover, the ability to open projects and WBS elements directly through Joule means that users can engage with their data more efficiently, fostering a productive and satisfied work environment. With these enhancements, businesses can ensure that their R&D projects are not only well managed but also effectively advancing toward their goals.

 

Navigating Bill of Materials with Joule

Imagine a workspace, where accessing Bill of Materials (BoM) is as straightforward as asking a colleague for the latest update, that's the seamless interaction Joule brings to the table. This AI-assisted natural language capability supports end users in navigating and managing BoM scenarios with ease, removing previous barriers to information. With Joule, users can effortlessly access header information, query BoMs by material-plant combinations, and select specific items, all through simple conversational prompts. Such simplification boosts productivity, allowing R&D teams to devote more time to product innovation and less to administrative navigation. By transforming BoM management into an intuitive, efficient process, Joule empowers users to make informed decisions, enhancing operational efficiency and ultimately driving business success.

For more information, refer to the SAP Help Portal.

 

AI-Enabled Precision in Handling Change Records

In Research and Development, managing change records is often time-consuming and complex. Teams must sift through detailed information, track overdue items, and ensure compliance ‚Äì all of which takes attention away from innovation.

Imagine handling change records as effortlessly as discussing project milestones with your team ‚Äì this is the transformative experience Joule brings to R&D operations. Joule simplifies interactions around change records, offering users intuitive access to detailed information at both header and item levels. By expediting the summarization process and enabling status changes, Joule ensures that overdue change records are discovered and addressed promptly, promoting efficient workflow and compliance. The capability to find records based on criteria such as product and reason for change further streamlines the management process, enabling teams to focus on innovation rather than paperwork. With these enhancements, R&D departments can make informed decisions more swiftly, driving their projects forward with the confidence that change management is both smooth and reliable.

 

For more details, refer to the dedicated pages on summarizing change record information and fetching change record information.

 

Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management

Streamlined project financials with Joule‚Äôs AI assistance

Handling complex financial data is one of the biggest hurdles in Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management. Now, picture managing a multifaceted project with the ease of a friendly chat ‚Äì that‚Äôs the vision Joule brings to life. With enhanced project assistant capabilities, Joule enables users to seamlessly access project financial and master data through intuitive natural language interactions. Gone are the days of toggling through applications and complex reports; now, project system users can effortlessly retrieve and summarize financial insights, aligning their focus on high-value tasks. This AI-driven ease not only boosts user satisfaction but also streamlines data collection and consolidation, making project management more efficient and effective. As a result, project teams can better navigate financial landscapes, ensuring that each decision supports the strategic vision. By leveraging Joule‚Äôs summarization and analytical prowess, organizations can enhance precision in project financial control, translating insights into impactful actions.


For more information, refer to SAP Help Portal. 

 

Summary

As we have explored, the SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 release introduces a transformative suite of AI-driven innovations that redefine what‚Äôs possible in enterprise operations. By harnessing the power of specialized agentic AI and Joule, businesses are now equipped to navigate complexities with clarity and precision, leading to optimized processes and strategic growth. We‚Äôre excited for you to experience these advancements firsthand and to see how they can empower your organization to achieve its goals with new-found efficiency and insight. Thank you for joining us on this journey through the future of intelligent enterprise solutions. Stay connected for more updates by following the with the PSCC_Enablement tag as we continue to innovate and shape the path forward for businesses worldwide. Don't forget to follow me (@Yannick_PTT) in the community as well as on LinkedIn to not miss any updates and insights.

For more information on intelligent capabilities integrated SAP Cloud ERP Private, explore the SAP Help Portal. 

More information

  • What‚Äôs New Viewer
  • From Innovation to Impact: SAP Cloud ERP Private 2025 Release (SAP News Center)
  • SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition Community
  • Help Portal SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • What`s New for Joule Capabilities
  • SAP Roadmap Explorer for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition
  • SAP Business Suite Product Expert Training 2025

We at Cloud ERP Product Success offer a service as versatile as our product itself. Check out the numerous offerings our team has created for you below:

entry.title: UX and application development with AI at ASUG Tech Connect 2025 a companion event to SAP TechEd
entry.content:
This year, SAP TechEd has several options to allow you to learn about the latest SAP technologies and how to apply them to your organization. In addition to TechEd in Berlin and the virtual option, there are ‚ÄúSAP TechEd On Tour‚Äù events in Louisville, Sydney, and Bangalore. In this post, I‚Äôll share the sessions on application development and user experience that we are presenting at ASUG Tech Connect in Louisville, Kentucky. As you would expect many have AI -assisted capabilities to make both business users and developers more productive.

 

At ASUG Tech Connect, we have both lectures and hands-on workshops.

Lectures are a chance to hear from SAP experts and have your questions answered in the room.

Extensibility with ABAP Cloud and AI in SAP Cloud ERP (Jens Weiler)
Explore on-stack key user and developer tools in the ABAP Cloud development model, now enhanced with generative AI. Extend standard apps and manage custom ones in SAP Cloud ERP and explore transactional, analytical, and integration use cases like the extensibility AI assistant, queries for analytical SAP Fiori apps, and SQL services.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 11:15 AM-12:05 PM

What‚Äôs Next: AI-First Innovations in SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite (Ullas Holla, Peter Spielvogel)
Get a fast-paced look at how SAP is embedding AI and delivering cross-suite innovations that break down silos and speed up decision-making. We‚Äôll cover the latest highlights from releases of SAP Cloud ERP and SAP Business Suite‚Äîplus give you a sneak peek at what‚Äôs coming in 2026 and beyond.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 3:30 PM-4:20 PM

Customer Show and Tell: From CDS View to Fiori Launchpad: Full-Stack Development with Eclipse ADT with Naturipe (Brian Galloway, Dario Cruz)
This session covers the end-to-end development workflow in the RISE with SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Private Edition environment using Eclipse ABAP Development Tools (ADT). It demonstrates how to define a data source and expose it via a CDS view, enabling consumption through SAP Fiori elements, Eclipse ADT, and Postman. A live demo illustrates the creation of a simple SAPUI5 application that consumes the same OData service and is deployed to the SAP Fiori Launchpad, showcasing full-stack integration from backend data modeling to frontend delivery.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 8:00 AM-9:30 AM

Using Generative AI to Accelerate SAP Fiori App Development (Ullas Holla)
AI changes everything, especially for developing business applications. See how SAP‚Äôs latest coding agents let you build SAP Fiori elements apps using a conversational interface. Create apps using Joule, including a CAP service, sample data, and SAPUI5 customizations.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 4:10 PM-5:00 PM

Creating Better User Experiences with AI-Powered SAP Fiori Apps (Peter Spielvogel)
Discover how the latest AI features in SAP Fiori apps enhance user productivity and streamline onboarding. Starting with My Home and diving into commonly used SAP Fiori apps, see how AI simplifies information access, supports informed business decisions, and fosters seamless collaboration. Explore how conversational interactions are making SAP more intuitive than ever.
Thursday, November 6, 2025, 4:15 PM-5:05 PM

Hands-on workshops give you the opportunity to test the latest SAP innovations and gain access to the same tools and technologies we use to build apps for SAP S/4HANA.

Hands-on Lab: Get Started with ABAP Cloud for Classic ABAP Developers
Familiar with classic ABAP development? Explore how similar development works with ABAP Cloud using the ABAP RESTful application programming model. Use ABAP Cloud to build cloud-ready business apps, services, and extensions that follow clean core principles by default‚Äîon SAP Business Technology Platform and in any edition of SAP S/4HANA.
Tuesday, November 4, 2025, 1:10 PM-3:10 PM

Hands-on Lab: Explore Joule for Developers, ABAP AI Capabilities
Learn how to develop transactional applications using the ABAP RESTful application model in ABAP Cloud while leveraging Joule capabilities for ABAP developers.
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 8:00 AM-10:00 AM

Hands-on Lab: Build On-Stack Extensions with ABAP Cloud in SAP Cloud ERP
Discover how to build extensions, applications, and services with the ABAP Cloud development model, using the ABAP RESTful application programming model and generative AI. You can explore how to extend standard SAP applications, consume public SAP APIs, and build new apps and services from scratch while getting practical insights through exercises
Wednesday, November 5, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

Hands-on Lab: Modernize Classic Extensions for Clean Core in SAP Cloud ERP Private
Practice clean core extensibility in SAP Cloud ERP Private. Learn how to govern clean core development using the ABAP test cockpit, and how to use the ABAP Cloud development model and clean core extensibility principles to modernize your custom on-stack extensions.
Thursday, November 6, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

Discovery Workshop: Start Your AI Agent Journey by Exploring AI Agent Use Cases 
In this discovery workshop, you will learn how AI Agents function and what makes a strong use case. You will identify and prioritize strategic AI Agent use cases for your business. For your selected use case, you will explore how AI Agent capabilities can address your specific business challenges and learn the next steps for designing and building an AI Agent using the SAP Agent Builder.
Thursday November 6, 2025, 1:00 PM-3:00 PM

I hope you can join us.

entry.title: SAP TechEd 2025: Your Must-Attend Sessions on SAP BTP
entry.content:
It feels like I came back from SAP Connect just yesterday, but SAP TechEd is now less than two weeks away. In addition to the virtual event, SAP TechEd 2025 will be held in five different cities and offer hundreds of sessions. Here‚Äôs my guide to the must-attend sessions for AI agents, SAP Business Technology Platform architecture, Extensions, and Integration across the world, as well as Virtual.

 

Why SAP TechEd 2025 is Unmissable

The enterprise technology landscape is evolving at breakneck speed, and SAP TechEd 2025 promises to be the defining moment where cutting-edge innovation meets hands-on expertise. SAP TechEd

  • SAP TechEd Virtual (November 4-6, 2025) provides the same high-quality technical content online for free for maximum accessibility, allowing you to explore the latest innovations in application development, integration, data, and AI from anywhere in the world

SAP TechEd on Tour

The SAP TechEd on Tour series delivers localized, immersive experiences tailored to regional technical communities. Each event combines the core SAP TechEd experience with region-specific insights, local expert networks, and formats optimized for different technical communities and career advancement goals.
